For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. # Kemira Oyj (KMT.HE) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
Kemira Oyj is a Finland-based global leader in sustainable chemical solutions and technologies primarily serving water-intensive industries. Founded in 1920 and headquartered in Helsinki, the company operates in two main segments: Pulp & Paper (accounting for ~60% of revenue) and Industry & Water (~40%). In Pulp & Paper, Kemira provides coagulation, retention, and drainage chemicals, as well as functional additives for papermaking processes to enhance efficiency, strength, and sustainability. In Industry & Water, it offers water treatment chemicals like polymers, biocides, and inorganic coagulants for municipal and industrial wastewater, alongside iron-based water chemicals for mining and construction. With ~4,800 employees across 30 countries and production in 35 facilities, Kemira emphasizes circular economy principles, digital services (e.g., Kemira's APEX monitoring tools), and bio-based innovations. In 2023, it generated €2,747 million in sales, focusing on high-value applications amid volatile raw material prices and shifting industry demands toward recycled fibers and water reuse. Kemira's strategy prioritizes margin expansion through pricing discipline, cost efficiencies, and targeted growth in emerging markets like Asia-Pacific. (187 words)

**Key Financial Snapshot (from Q3 2024 Earnings, released October 25, 2024):**
| Metric                  | Q3 2024 Value | YoY Change | 9M 2024 Value | YoY Change |
|-------------------------|---------------|------------|---------------|------------|
| Sales                   | €685 million | -1%       | €2,047 million | -2%       |
| Comparable EBITA        | €89 million (11.0% margin) | +2% | €252 million (12.3% margin) | +1% |
| Operating EBITA         | €85 million (12.4% margin) | +5% | €239 million (11.7% margin) | Flat |
| EPS (continuing ops)    | €0.47        | +6%       | €1.29        | -2%       |

**Current Stock Metrics (as of November 8, 2024, close via Nasdaq Helsinki):**
- Stock Price: €25.95
- Market Cap: €2.56 billion
- 52-Week Range: €21.50 - €28.50
- Dividend Yield: 4.2% (annual €1.09/share proposed for 2024)

## Recent Developments
- **October 25, 2024**: Q3 2024 earnings showed resilient margins despite soft volumes; raised full-year comparable EBITA guidance to €340-370 million (prior €330-360 million).
- **September 12, 2024**: Launched new sustainable dry strength program for board and packaging grades at Tissue World Miami.
- **July 19, 2024**: Q2 2024 results: Sales €675 million (-2% YoY), comparable EBITA €85 million (12.6% margin).
- **June 2024**: Acquired full ownership of joint venture in China for water treatment enzymes.
- **May 2024**: Announced €50 million investment in Espoo R&D center expansion for water treatment innovations (completion 2026).
- **March 2024**: Q1 sales €687 million (-1% YoY), EBITA €78 million.

## Growth Strategy
- Focus on "Value over Volume": Pricing actions, premium product mix shift, and operational excellence targeting 12-15% EBITA margins long-term.
- Sustainability roadmap: 50% bio-based product portfolio by 2030; €100 million+ annual R&D spend.
- Geographic expansion: Asia-Pacific (India/China) and Americas growth via greenfield plants (e.g., new polymer plant in Brazil, operational 2025).
- Digitalization: Rollout of AI-driven APEX+ platform for real-time process optimization, deployed in 50+ mills by end-2024.
- M&A pipeline: Bolt-on acquisitions in water tech (target €200-300 million deployable capital).

## Headwinds and Tailwinds
| Category       | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|----------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company**   | Weak pulp/paper demand (e.g., -5% volumes in Q3 2024); raw material volatility (TiO2, acrylamide). | Strong pricing (+2% in Q3); cost savings €30 million annualized from restructuring. |
| **Sector**    | Global paper production decline (-2% in 2024 per RISI); regulatory pressures on PFAS chemicals. | Rising water scarcity drives treatment demand (+4% global market growth); fiber recycling mandates boost chemical needs. |

## Products/Services
- **Existing**:
  - Pulp & Paper: Fennopol polymers (60% market focus), FennoFlex strength agents, SuperCalco calcium carbonate.
  - Industry & Water: Fena™ polyaluminum chloride (PAC), Kemira SolidBridge sludge handling, biocides for oil/gas.
- **New/Planned**:
  - Bio-based dry strength additives (launched Sept 2024 for packaging).
  - Next-gen APEX digital suite with AI predictive analytics (pilots in 2024, full rollout 2025).
  - PFAS-free wet-end solutions (development accelerated post-EU regs, trials Q4 2024).
  - Enzyme boosters for wastewater (from China JV, scaling 2025).

## Market Share and Forecasts
- **Current Approximations** (2023-2024 estimates from company reports, RISI, McKinsey):
  | Segment              | Kemira Share | Key Notes |
  |----------------------|--------------|-----------|
  | Global Wet-End Chemicals (Pulp/Paper) | 20-25%     | #1 in EMEA/North America. |
  | Papermaking PCC     | 15-20%      | Strong in board/kraft. |
  | Industrial Water Polymers | 10-15%    | Growing in mining. |
- **Forecast**: Stable to +1-2% annual gain through 2027 via premium products/digital; overall sector growth 2-3%, Kemira outpacing via 3-5% pricing.

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (2023/2024) | Kemira | Ecolab (Water Div.) | Solvay (Water Tech) | Nalco (Ecolab sub) |
|--------------------|--------|----------------------|---------------------|--------------------|
| Revenue (€B)      | 2.75  | ~5 (water only)     | ~1.5               | ~3                |
| EBITA Margin      | 12%   | 18%                 | 14%                | 20%               |
| Market Cap (€B)   | 2.6   | 60+                 | 10+                | N/A               |
| Growth (YoY Sales)| -2%   | +5%                 | +1%                | +3%               |
- Kemira leads in niche pulp/paper chemistry; lags Ecolab in scale/digital but trades at lower 10x EV/EBITA vs. peers' 15x+.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: UPM (fiber recycling pilot, 2024); Veolia (municipal water AI collab, ongoing); Sappi (sustainable packaging R&D).
- **M&A**: Acquired R3 Water (US wastewater sensors, Jan 2024); full buyout of Novozymes JV in China (June 2024). Divested non-core disinfectants business (Q1 2024).
- **Major Clients**: International Paper, Stora Enso, Suzano (pulp); Veolia, Suez (water); BHP, Rio Tinto (mining). Potential: Asian board producers (e.g., Nine Dragons) amid China expansion.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- ESG: Top 5% in Sustainalytics (low risk); 95% renewable electricity; CDP Water A-list.
- Management: CEO Annica Bresky (since 2017) track record of 10%+ TSR.
- Risks: Geopolitical (Ukraine war impacts TiO2); currency (strong EUR headwind).
- Sentiment: Positive analyst consensus (8/11 Buy/Hold per Inderes/Consensus); online forums (e.g., Seeking Alpha, Oct 2024) highlight dividend safety amid stability.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 7/10 (Hold-to-Buy; undervalued vs. peers on cash flow, 4%+ yield supports moderate risk; limited near-term growth but defensive quality).
- **Estimated Fair Value**: €32.00/share (23% upside; DCF-based on 3% sales CAGR to 2027, 13% EBITA margin, 8x terminal multiple; aligns with strong growth portfolio targeting 15%+ annual returns, moderate volatility via staples exposure).
